definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: Rain or shine, we'll have to go tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 不論晴雨，我們明天非去不可。

sentences.english: The Immortal Bathtub is famous for its changing water-color , which can forebode the weather and the earthquake.
sentences.chinese: “仙人澡塘”以水色的變化能預兆晴雨和地震而聞名。

sentences.english: Brad took his daughter walking every day, rain or shine.
sentences.chinese: 不論晴雨，布萊德每天都會帶女兒去散步。
不論晴雨，星期五我都會來看你的。

sentences.english: Rain or shine, I walk to school every day.
sentences.chinese: 無論晴雨，我每天走路上學。

sentences.english: Baseball cap or hat for sun and rain.
sentences.chinese: 一頂棒球帽或晴雨兩用帽。

sentences.english: I got up at five o'clock in the morning, rain or shine.
sentences.chinese: 無論晴雨，我都是早上五點起牀。

definition: the four seasons/spring, summer, autumn and winter
lit. daily changes of temperature/fig. well-being/sb's comfort, health, prosperity etc
variable/changeable/fickle/impermanence (Sanskrit: anitya)/ghost taking away the soul after death/to pass away/to die
four seasons, namely: spring 春, summer 夏, autumn 秋 and winter 冬
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
